title: Golf-Mickelson ends five-year drought with playoff win over Thomas
text: March 4, 2018 / 11:38 PM / Updated 8 hours ago Golf-Mickelson ends five-year drought with playoff win over Thomas Reuters Staff 1 Min Read March 4 (Reuters) - Phil Mickelson won a first hole playoff with Justin Thomas to claim his first victory in five years at the WGC-Mexico Championship on Sunday. The 47-year-old Hall of Famer sank a par putt on the 17th hole for his first win since the 2013 British Open. The Americans had finished regulation tied at 16-under 268. Thomas had an eagle on the 18th to finish with a seven-under 64. Mickelson later finished with a 66 to force the playoff at Club de Golf Chapultepec in Mexico City. (Reporting by Gene Cherry in Salvo, North Carolina; Editing by Ian Ransom)
